titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the Internal Revenue Service may waive interest on underpayments attributable to retroactive tax legislation.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 3/3/1988--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to waive interest on income tax underpayments created or increased as a result of retroactive legislation when: (1) requiring the interest payment would be against equity and good conscience; and (2) the interest has accrued within 30 days after the enactment date of the relevant legislation.
